com.quest.glue.api.services
Interface ServiceFactory

public interface ServiceFactory

Factory that allocates any type of Service. This includes agent registered services. The factory will also allow for dependency injection.

Each ServiceFactory knows which Agent it has been assigned to, and the Services allocated by it will also be associated with that Agent.

Since:
5.2.0

Nested Class Summary
static class ServiceFactory.InjectionFailedException
          Exception generated when a dependency injection fails.
static class ServiceFactory.ServiceNotAvailableException
          Exception thrown when the requested service is not available.

Method Detail

bind

<AgentInterface,AgentImpl extends AgentInterface> void bind(java.lang.Class<AgentInterface> interfaceClass,
                                                            java.lang.Class<AgentImpl> implementationClass)
          throws ServiceFactory.InjectionFailedException
Registers an agent provided interface (or class) and the corresponding implementation. Whenever an instance of the interface is request (either directory or via dependency injection) a new instance of the corresponding implementation class will be created (and have any declared dependencies injected)

Note: The parameters can refer to the same class or a super class and subclass. An interface is not strictly required.

Parameters:
interfaceClass - The interface class that is to be exposed
implementationClass - a class that implements the provided interface. New instances of this class will be returned whenever an instance of the interfaceClass is requested.
Throws:
ServiceFactory.InjectionFailedException - if there are any error with the injection such as a missing implementation or a circular dependency.
Since:
5.6.10
See Also:
unbind(Class)

bindInstance

<AgentInterface,AgentImpl extends AgentInterface> void bindInstance(java.lang.Class<AgentInterface> interfaceClass,
                                                                    AgentImpl implementationInstance)
                  throws ServiceFactory.InjectionFailedException
Registers an agent provided interface and the corresponding implementation. Whenever an instance of the interface is request (either directory or via dependency injection) the registered instance of the corresponding implementation class will be returned. Dependency injection is not automatically performed on the implementation class.

Note: The parameters can refer to the same class or a super class and subclass. An interface is not strictly required.

Parameters:
interfaceClass - The interface class that is to be exposed
implementationInstance - an instance that implements the provided interface. This exact class instance will be returned whenever an instance of the interfaceClass is requested.
Throws:
ServiceFactory.InjectionFailedException - if there are any error with the injection such as a missing implementation or a circular dependency.
Since:
5.6.10
See Also:
unbind(Class)

getAgentService

<AgentServiceType> AgentServiceType getAgentService(java.lang.Class<AgentServiceType> type)
                                 throws ServiceFactory.InjectionFailedException
Returns a previously bound implementation for the provided interface. If the interface was bound to a class, a new instance of that class is returned. If it was bound to a specific instance, then that instance is returned. Newly created classes will have all their requested injections set. This includes their field, constructor, and method injections.

Parameters:
type - The interface type for which a implementation is requested.
Returns:
An instance of a class that implements the requested interface. The interface must have been previously bound with bind(Class, Class) or bindInstance(Class, Object).
Throws:
ServiceFactory.InjectionFailedException - if there are any error with the injection such as a missing implementation or a circular dependency.
Since:
5.6.10
See Also:
injectDependencies(Object)

getService

<ServiceType extends Service> ServiceType getService(java.lang.Class<ServiceType> serviceType)
                                       throws ServiceFactory.ServiceNotAvailableException
Get an implementation of the Service interface.

Parameters:
serviceType - The type of service requested.
Returns:
An implementation of the requested service class
Throws:
ServiceFactory.ServiceNotAvailableException - if the requested service cannot be provided

injectDependencies

void injectDependencies(java.lang.Object o)
                        throws ServiceFactory.InjectionFailedException
Scans the provided object for any methods annotated with Inject, and any fields annotated with Inject. Each method will be called with an instance of the class that matches each of its parameters and any non-null field will have a instance of the requested class assigned. The injected class can either be an agent bound class or service provided by FglAM. Example: 

   public interface IFace {}
   public class Impl implements IFace {}
   
   public class Target {
      @Inject private IFace injectedInterface;
      @Inject Target(LogService logsvc) {}      
      @Inject public void assignServices(UnitService unitService, AgentStatusService statSvc) {}
   }
   
   public class Controller { 
       public Controller(ServiceFactory sf) { 
           // Alternative 1
           Target t = new Target(sf.getLogService()); // constructor params not injected
           sf.injectDependencies(t);
           
           // Alternative 2, (if Alternative 1 is not selected and
           //                 and Target.class has been bound already)
           t = sf.getAgentService(Target.class); // constructor params injected
           
           // In both alternative, t has the field injectedInterface set and
           // t.assignService() was called with the required parameters
       }
   }

Parameters:
o - The object into which dependencies will be injected.
Throws:
ServiceFactory.InjectionFailedException - if there are any error with the injection such as a missing implementation or a circular dependency.
Since:
5.6.10

newInstanceOf

<AgentServiceType> AgentServiceType newInstanceOf(java.lang.Class<AgentServiceType> type)
                               throws ServiceFactory.InjectionFailedException
A helper method to create a new instance of the specified agent class, with all its dependencies injected. This does not require the class type to have been previously bound, and the class type will not be used for further injections.

Parameters:
type - The class type that will be instantiated. It must have either a no-args constructor or exactly one constructor annotated with Inject.
Returns:
A new instance of the provided class type, with all dependencies injected.
Throws:
ServiceFactory.InjectionFailedException - if there are any error with the injection such as a missing implementation or a circular dependency.
Since:
5.6.10
See Also:
getAgentService(Class)

unbind

void unbind(java.lang.Class<?> interfaceClass)
Removed the provided type from both the list of bound types and bound instances.

Parameters:
interfaceClass - The class to be unbound from the service factory. The provided type will no longer be available for dependency injection.
Since:
5.6.10
See Also:
bind(Class, Class), bindInstance(Class, Object)
